Key Match Events: The Hornets missed their first four shots off the second quarter and turned the ball over three times, leading to six points for Cleveland on a 13-2 run that pushed the lead to 42-25.
Post-Match Reflections: Hornets Head Coach Charles Lee: "I thought that we started a little slow, and when you’re coming on the road and playing a good team like that, they definitely make you pay for every mistake you make... But we’re fighting, we’re competing, we’re trying to find ways of having better offensive possessions so that it doesn’t continue to put as much pressure on our defense"
Miscellaneous Highlights: LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller returned to the Hornets lineup after missing three games with their respective injuries.
Others: Nick Smith Jr. scored a season-high 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting from the field and 4-of-6 shooting from outside the arc. Miles Bridges (23.3 points, 10.3 rebounds) and Mark Williams (16.7 points, 10.3 rebounds) both averaged double-doubles in Ball and Miller’s absence the past three games.
